org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jdbc.reader
Class JDBCReadConnector

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jdbc.reader.JDBCReadConnector
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IEnrichmentReadConnector, IReadConnector, ITransactional
public class JDBCReadConnector
extends Component
implements IEnrichmentReadConnector, ITransactional

Generic JDBC polling read connector that replaced: The legacy (pre 3.3) JDBCReadConnector is equivalent to this connector with the LoopingPollingReadConnector with no parameters. The legacy (pre 3.3) JDBCPollConnector is equivalent to this connector with the LoopingPollingReadConnector with pollLimit and pollInterval parameters set. The legacy (pre 3.3) JDBCEventReadConnector is equivalent to this connector with the DBEventDrivenPollingReadConnector. Associates a ResultSetConvertor with the connector, by default this is DEFAULT_CONVERTOR.

Author:
Eddy Higgins, Kris Lachor

setReaderContext

public void setReaderContext(java.lang.Object context)
Attempts to convert the context to a callable statement. This will only be successfull if the context is an IOrderedMap with elements in a predefined format, such as that returned by DBEventDrivenPollingReadConnector. If successfull, the callable statement will be used for polling the database. Otherwise, the context will be ingored.

Specified by:
setReaderContext in interface IReadConnector
Parameters:
context - - context as an IOrderedMap
See Also:
IReadConnector.setReaderContext(Object)

getReaderContext

public java.lang.Object getReaderContext()
Description copied from interface: IReadConnector
Allows an implementation to provide some resource specific context that relates to the data it is providing. This is typically passed to "downstream" components that process the polled data.

Specified by:
getReaderContext in interface IReadConnector
Returns:
null
See Also:
IReadConnector.getReaderContext()

setBatchSize

public void setBatchSize(int batchSize)
Sets the batch size. A negative number of zero will correspond to IResultSetConverter.CONVERT_ALL - the batch will contain all rows from the result set. Batch size equal to 1 corresponds to IResultSetConverter.CONVERT_ONE, which'll fetch the next records from the result set on every call to next(long).

Parameters:
batchSize - the batch size

getResource

public java.lang.Object getResource()
Description copied from interface: ITransactional
If the implementation wants to take part in the current transaction then it should either return an instance of ITransactionalResource or and instance of XAResource. It is assumed that the configured transaction manager that creates the actual transaction will match type of resource return. Return null if the component is not configured to be transactional.

Specified by:
getResource in interface ITransactional
Returns:
the output
See Also:
ITransactional.getResource(), JDBCConnection.getTransactionalResource()
